messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Has anyone seen this?
messages.msgSnippet: ... That s Gail Withrow s site;  ho, hum, old news   at least in California, where she was a featured speaker at The Link conference a few years back. She s
messages.messageBody:
on 9/25/02 10:16 PM, Julie W at xtr581602@... wrote:

> A woman on one our New Zealand e-mail groups has just found this website
> http://www.hometaught.com/what_is_homeschooling.htm and as a parent of young
> children just starting out in making her choice it has caused her some
> insecurity.
>
> I felt pretty insulted by the content especially the "close but not really"
> page where she seems to allege unschoolers neglect their children
> educationally. I am sure someone here can verbalise my misgivings more
> clearly.
>
> Personally I would just ignore the webpage as being published by someone
> with an agenda and a business but I would like to put some useful
> reassurance the way of the person who originally stumbled on the site.

That's Gail Withrow's site; ho, hum, old news <g> at least in California,
where she was a featured speaker at The Link conference a few years back.

She's an Objectivist (Ayn Rand follower). Take a peek at
http://www.aynrand.org/

Nancy

messages.subject: Has anyone seen this?
messages.msgSnippet: A woman on one our New Zealand e-mail groups has just found this website http://www.hometaught.com/what_is_homeschooling.htm and as a parent of young children
messages.messageBody:
A woman on one our New Zealand e-mail groups has just found this website
http://www.hometaught.com/what_is_homeschooling.htm and as a parent of young
children just starting out in making her choice it has caused her some
insecurity.

I felt pretty insulted by the content especially the "close but not really"
page where she seems to allege unschoolers neglect their children
educationally. I am sure someone here can verbalise my misgivings more
clearly.

Personally I would just ignore the webpage as being published by someone
with an agenda and a business but I would like to put some useful
reassurance the way of the person who originally stumbled on the site.


I seems to me no-one has a right to judge/or define others choices but I was
just wondering what reaction is here?

Julie W
Wellington
